definition: appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)

sentences.english: Dates become a series of business negotiations, often hard-nosed.
sentences.chinese: 約會成爲一系列商務談判，常常就像討價還價。

sentences.english: She eventually chose a photographer as her date on the show.
sentences.chinese: 最終，馬諾在節目裏選擇了一名攝影師約會。

sentences.english: Thirty-six percent of singles would consider dating someone in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 36%的單身者會考慮與同事約會。
昨晚我們參加兩對男女的約會。

sentences.english: I was going to see Mrs. Ked the next day, but the appointment has been cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我本打算第二天去看基德先生，但是約會被取消了。

sentences.english: Do you whisper such sweet nothings to all the girls that you date?
sentences.chinese: 你對其他和你約會的女孩也說這些甜言蜜語嗎？

sentences.english: Tom's been dating Alice for two years.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆與艾麗斯兩年來一直在約會。

sentences.english: You ask her out a second time and she agrees.
sentences.chinese: 你向他提出第二次約會邀請並且她同意了。

sentences.english: As soon as the scary music kick in, your date  cuddles closer for comfort.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖音樂一開始，你的約會對象就會抱緊你以求安慰。

sentences.english: Your dating partner could ask you, "Tell me about yourself."
sentences.chinese: 你約會的對象可能會問你，“跟我聊聊你自己吧。”

sentences.english: The drag and drop feature allows you to drag an appointment, for example, to a new time.
sentences.chinese: 拖放功能允許您將一個約會拖動到一個新的時間。

sentences.english: Henry's date was very laconic, saying two sentences the entire evening.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的約會十分簡潔，整晚他只說了兩句話。

sentences.english: Henry's date was very laconic, only saying two sentences the entire evening.
sentences.chinese: 亨利的約會十分簡潔，整晚他只說了兩句話。

sentences.english: Jesse married his own first cousin after a nine-year courtship.
sentences.chinese: 傑西在和自己的表妹約會九年之後結婚。
先在其中寫出已經安排好的約會。

sentences.english: Learn the art of the Cheap Date. The student’s guide to cheap dates suggests

party/gathering/to meet/to get together
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to invite/to make an appointment
to refuse/to decline/to reject
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
handsome guy/lady-killer/handsome (form of address)
wedding ceremony/wedding/CL:場|场[chang3]
to see
Valentine's Day
they/them (for females)
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
